content.description: Start almost on the left arete (on the BACKSIDE of 'Maiden Voyage Boulder'). Don't use the left arete but rather start on a sidepull edge (righthand) and a crimp/jug (lefthand). From here, move up on slope-y, edgy crimps, and move straight up into a light colored pocket that is amazing! From here, top out.
content.location: Find this problem on the backside of Maiden Voyage Boulder, on the more "challenging" face on 'Maiden Voyage Boulder' almost on the left arete. You will find the distinct, right hand, sidepull edge in an awesome, skull-looking pocket.

content.description:
Use the same jug start as '

Aye Aye

'. From here, it moves out left on a series of sloper crimps and links up with '

Jack Sparrow

' on the topout (reference the photo).
content.location:
On backside of 'Maiden Voyage Boulder,' use the same start as '

Aye Aye

'. The most obvious jug is on the backside face.

content.description:
Start on a massive jug. From here, move out right to a great crimp edge. Move your left hand up to a sloper crimp. Bump your left hand to a crimp pocket. Match your hands. Finish with a juggy topout!

'Aye Aye' Variation: use a smaller, two finger crimp instead of the first crimp edge (see the photo included for reference!). This more of an elimination variation. The grade is: V3+
content.location: Start on the obvious jug with great feet in the center of 'Maiden Voyage' Boulder. Climb left parallel to the crack in the boulder.
